text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['6. teymangangasien ko ya', '我也是有愛心的人', 'I am a loving person', '', 'si apen Kotan/Jinovoy (M, 75, Yayo)', '王仁德，男，75，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: ika-tlo na araw am, “mi tamo mi-lolo so kayo-kayo ta”, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: 第三天，“我們去山上拉木柴” ，“好啊”
On the third day, I said, “Let’s go drag the wood.” “Okay.”

S.FORM: pa-pat namen a ma-key-keyray a mi-kay-kayo,
S.TRANSL: 我們共四個同伴，常常一起睡覺，一起去撿木柴
The four of us often slept and picked up wood together.

S.FORM: ta ya rana ji mi-ka-kayo siciaikoa ya am, ji a-tey-sa ka vahay o kayo-kayo namen a aboa-boak-en namen a mata,
S.TRANSL: 現代的人已經不砍木柴了。不像以前，我們常常去砍木柴來劈堆满一屋子
Now young men don’t like to cut wood anymore. Unlike our good old days when a bunch of us would go and cut wood to take home to split, and sometimes would cut enough to fill the house.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, to ko a-cita si mina apen Kalalanet ito a mi-saboay so cinengeh na am,
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我看見si apen Kalalanet從山上扛建材回家
One day, I saw si apen Kalalanet coming back from cutting wood with a pile of construction material on his back.

S.FORM: “wo, ji ko maci-pa-lolog jinio manga ke-hakay, citoai am, mi ko sinmo-en inio a,
S.TRANSL: 我就對同伴說，“噢！各位同伴，我現在不能跟你們一起滾（木柴），等一下我再去跟你們會合
“Hey, friends, I can’t go roll (the wood) with you now. Go ahead first, I’ll be there in a second,” I said to my friends.

S.FORM: “ásio ka manga anak ko, a ma-nat mo ya?” “a ji rana a-nat ito” koan ko a,
S.TRANSL: “孩子，你怎麼來了，你扛得動嗎？” 我說“（就這麼小）怎會扛不動？”
“Son, why have you come? Are you strong enough to carry it?” “(This is very small). Am I not strong enough to carry it?” I said.

S.FORM: “a ji na imo ’oya-n ni ama mo, ta ya na imo pi-rara-en so ya ma-rehmet ni ama mo a ya asa anak na”,
S.TRANSL: “你是你爸爸的獨生子，他不讓你扛重的東西，你這樣做他會生氣的”
“You are your father’s only son, and he will not let you carry heavy things, so if he finds out about it, he will be angry.”

S.FORM: “tang ang, a ya ma-kongo!”, a ji na pa-sovay-i yaken am, to na rana m-tad-an a,
S.TRANSL: “啊呀，有什麼關係？” 他拗不過我，只好放下（建材）
“Ah, what does it matter?” He could not beat me, so he had to put the wood down (and let me carry it to the village).

S.FORM: am ai no vahay na am, ji a-ta-tarípis o ai no vahay da nokakoa ya,
S.TRANSL: 那是房子的柱子，不過以前的屋柱都滿細的
That was his house’s pillar, but the pillars before were very thin.

S.FORM: am-ian rana do vahay da am i-ptad ko rana, ma-ngay ko rana mi s-om-inmo so ka-raray ko am,
S.TRANSL: 到了他們家，我就把建材放下，然後又跑去跟我的同伴們會合
At his house, I put it down and ran back to meet with my friends.

S.FORM: am-ian do ka-soli-an am, ma-sinmo ko sira a,
S.TRANSL: 我在芋田區趕上了他們
I caught up with them at the taro fields.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “ya mo pa ni-ma-hap ori?” “a ya ji a-paw, ta ya ji a-tarípis a”
S.TRANSL: “哇，你真行，居然還扛回村去？” “很輕啦，薄薄的一根木頭而已”
“Wow, (the village is so far away), and you still managed to carry it back?” “It was only a light, thin piece of wood.”

S.FORM: ratateng am, o ra-rakeh ori am, “a ji ka ma-ka-rilaw manga anak ko a, tang ang, a mi mo i-pi-ra-rahet o vahay ko, ta ikong o nake-nákem ko jimo, manga anak ko?”
S.TRANSL: 那個老人對我說，“真不好意思，還為了我們的家勞累了你的身體？我拿什麼回報你呢，孩子” 。
“I find it embarrassing that you had to work so hard for my house,” the old man said. “How will I repay you, son?”

S.FORM: ratateng am, i-pa-npeng da yamen so asa vagato a ara-ráko a ora,
S.TRANSL: 後來他就裝了一盆大大的芋頭給我們
He gave me a big bowl of taro.

S.FORM: k-amo-amo na rana nira ina icialaw am, ori o rali-in no ka-ji ko mi-walam-an,
S.TRANSL: 這使我的父母親反而覺得不好意思。因此我不好的地方就是太好動
My parents felt embarrassed by the gift. This is the negative side of my activeness.

S.FORM: ta ma-ngasi ko so tao a, no maka-cita ko so ra-rakeh a mapa-don so kan-kan-en da am, to ko i mehes-a jira o rara-rara da,
S.TRANSL: 因為我是個富有同情心的人。每當我看到老人家揹很多的食物時，我就會去搶下來幫忙揹著
I always helped people in need. Every time I saw an old man carrying a heavy load of food, I would go and help.

S.FORM: no ma-níring sira o ma-wala-walam am, “a ya to-da ji mi-wey-walam si aci ta ori am, ya tey-má-ngasi so ra-rakeh a,
S.TRANSL: 當有一群在聊天的人看到了我的情形，就說“我們這個（男）孩子雖然好動，卻也是最憐憫同情老人家的人
A group of old people were talking about me when they knew about my behavior. “This boy is so wild, yet he is the one who is most compassionate to the elders” they said.

S.FORM: no ya pa-pataw am, sia rana ji ma-naza so tao am, yaten a ma-key-ke-yli-an a aro a ka-k-anak-an a,
S.TRANSL: 當四、五月（飛魚季）的時候，村人及很多的小孩子已經不再幫忙歸航的漁船拖船上岸
“Every time when April and May come around [the season of flying fish, none of the people and the kids in the village help pull boats to shore anymore.

S.FORM: iya ori o ika-ra-roa no ya mapi-tatala sia a ya to nglid no tao a ya arala-en am, ya na i-pa-ngasi so tao no nang am,
S.TRANSL: 只有他還繼續幫忙每一個船主把船拖上岸去，因此他實在是一個很有憐憫心的人
Only he still helps each boat owner pull boats ashore, so he is very compassionate.

S.FORM: ano akma sia o toda a-viay am, a ji abo ka-ji na a-pintek-an no nia” koan da am,
S.TRANSL: 如果這個人能活著，他一定是長命的人” 他們這樣說我
If he can keep himself alive, he will live long.” They were talking about me.

S.FORM: no nake-nakem-en ko am, “wo, oyod a ji ko a-viay-i ya, da ka-kma so k-ama da” am, a ta ya ko ikoan-en o ka-ji a-pintek-an,
S.TRANSL: 有時候我也在想，“喔，我真的不長命嗎？那些人真該死（竟詛咒我），喝！我才不在乎長不長壽什麼的
“Oh, will I really have a short life? They should all go to hell. Ah, I don’t care if I live long or not,” I thought occasionally.

S.FORM: a ya ma-kongo, ta ji a-pintek am, koanata alla-llag saon am” koan ko am,
S.TRANSL: 不長命又怎麼樣，命是天註定的”
“It doesn’t matter if it is short, for life is predestined.”

S.FORM: “ka-bagbag an, ma-hap na o ka-pi-igen no kataotao na, a mi-ka-osong ori, a to mí-ka-osong ta ji a-zakat rana ori simakteysaraw” koan da am,
S.TRANSL: “敢賭死啦，他絕不可能活到中壯年的；他也不可能娶太太的，因為後天就要死掉的人了, 怎麼可能娶太太？” 他們都這麼講
“I bet he won’t live to middle age, and won’t even think about getting a wife. Maybe he will die the day after tomorrow.”

S.FORM: ori o kasi-kasi-sinmo-en ko, a to da mánci-an yaken a ji mipa-pia a.
S.TRANSL: 以上都是我的親身經歷。被他們亂說是沒有希望的人
This is my personal experience. They all said that I had no future and no hope,

S.FORM: tateng am, o ni-manci niaken ori am, adaday a omo-omot-an rana o to-to-toang da do ka-valino-an am,
S.TRANSL: 如今，曾說過我不長命的那些人，埋在馬鞍藤底下，骨頭都已長了青苔呢
but those who said I would not live long are all now lying underneath Beach morning glory and their bones are already growing moss.

S.FORM: ori a, ya rana wara siciakoa ya am, ji abo ka-paka-hap da so siko-sikod da no ka-mang-anak-an da no ni-manci niaken a ji a-pin-pintek am,
S.TRANSL: 這就是（我的童年情形）；而今，那些說過我不長命的人，他們的後代也是絕對活不到柱著拐杖的年紀（未老即死）的
Therefore, the descendents of those who used to say I would not live long will die early before they are old enough to use canes.

S.FORM: ori o ko sin-sinmo-en an, a to da ma-ngata-ngátay-i a ka-tlo a kawan a, ka-pat a araw a k-anak-an am,
S.TRANSL: 以上是我的親身經歷；在我年紀還小的時候，就常被人咒詛說頂多活三年，活四天等等的話
This is my personal experience. People always said I would only live three years or four days, when I was only a child.

S.FORM: ji manci-i no ji mi-walam a k-anak-an a, o ma-nakaw so i-sovo a kan-en am, ori o ma-lahet am,
S.TRANSL: 所以不要亂詛咒好動的小孩（說命不長）。只有吃了偷來的東西才是壞事情
So don’t say that wild children will die early. Only people who steal food and put into their mouths are bad.

S.FORM: a ma-nakaw so apza-pzat-an no tao do ka-va-vahay a ma-ndep so ka-vahay-an am,
S.TRANSL: 或者闖入他人的屋宅去偷人的東西（是壞事）
Those who break into someone’s house (are bad) too.

S.FORM: a to man-’acing so korang am, ji mi-wey-walam a ma-makbak so k-anak-an am, a ya ma-kongo o akma so sang,
S.TRANSL: 但若只是好動，去絆豬，打別人的小孩等事有什麼關係？
But what’s so bad about those who go play around and tie up pigs’ legs or sometimes hit other children?

S.FORM: ori o ni-ka-law ko noka-metdeh ko manga ka-kteh do cinai, a to rana ngia-ngian-i do ili a ra-rakeh.
S.TRANSL: 各位兄弟姊妹們，以上是我小時候曾令我擔心的事情。如今，我只能待在家裡， 變成了沒用的老人家了
This is something that I worried about in my younger days. Now I am already an old man who does nothing but sit at home every day.

S.FORM: a ji rana maka-maog so ka-ngay do takey am, k-ian no pipa-kavos-en, ta ya rana ji a-teneng a ya mapa-kavo-kavos o ra-rakeh.
S.TRANSL: 即使還有尚未完成的事情，也不知道如何去完成; 因為人老了，沒有辦法上山去工作了
I can’t work on the mountains anymore. Even if there is something I want to do, I feel that I am too old to have the power to do it.

S.FORM: am ori an, o kasi-kasi-sinmo-en ko nok-ali-alikey ko manga ka-kteh do cinai. hadiloya!
S.TRANSL: 以上是我小時候的親身經歷，各位弟兄姊妹。哈利路亞！
This was my personal experience while I was young. Hallelujah!

S.FORM: i-osok ko pa o cinengeh ni maran ta ito” koan ko a, to ko i nga-hap-a jia am,
S.TRANSL: 我先去幫叔叔扛一下建材” ，我就去幫他的扛建材
“I’m going to help our uncle over there haul wood,” and I went to help him carry the wood home.

S.FORM: ratateng am, to ko manazisí-an rana ori a, ori a ka-panazisi ko nia,
S.TRANSL: 我扛了建材以後就快步的直奔村莊去
Once I got it on my shoulders, I ran to the village.

S.FORM: ka-palayo ko nia i-oli do ka-vahay-an da am,
S.TRANSL: 然後用跑的揹回到他們的家裡去
I would carry the things to their homes in running.

S.FORM: ori o nake-nakem noka-li-alikey ko a, ko rana man-nake-nakem siciaikoa ya am, ma-níring sira o karoan no ra-rakeh am,
S.TRANSL: 這是我小時候的想法，如今我回想起來，有些老人這麼說過
This was my thinking when I was young. Come to think of it, some of the elders said,

S.FORM: ori o i-k-alaw ko, “oyod a ma-zakat ko ya, jira ka-bagbag, am k-om-oan am, alla-llag saon am”,
S.TRANSL: 我曾經因此擔心過，我想“我真的會像他們說的就要死掉了嗎？他們才要死哩，就看命運吧，不然能怎麼樣？”
This caused me to worry, and I thought, “Will I really die like they say? They should all go to hell. But if it’s my fate, then I can’t avoid it, so just let it be.”
